User Story: As a student, I want to sign up, log in, and see my profile with my roles so that I can access the marketplace with the right permissions.
As a seller, I want to create a new listing with details and photos so that buyers can see what I’m selling.
As a seller, I want to edit or update or delete my listing so that I can keep details accurate.
As a seller, I want to mark a listing as SOLD so that other buyers don’t contact me about it.
As a buyer, I want to search listings with keywords and filters so that I can quickly find relevant items.
As a buyer, I want to view a listing’s details so that I can decide whether to message the seller.
As a buyer, I want to start a 1:1 chat with the seller from a listing page so that I can negotiate.
As a participant, I want to send and view chat messages in a thread so that I can communicate with the other party.
As a user, I want to report a listing with a reason so that admins can review suspicious content.
As a developer, I want seed data and a health endpoint so that the app is demo-ready and monitored.
As a user, I want to view and edit my profile information so that I can update my name, photo, or contact details.
As a seller, I want to see all my active and sold listings in one place so that I can manage them easily.
As a buyer, I want to save or favorite a listing so that I can revisit it later without searching again.
As a buyer, I want to view all my saved listings so that I can easily compare or contact sellers later.
As an admin, I want to delete inappropriate or duplicate listings so that I can maintain the quality of the marketplace.
As an admin, I want to hide or restore a listing so that I can moderate without deleting it permanently.
As an admin, I want to send a warning message to a seller when their listing violates the rules so that they can fix the issue.
As an admin, I want to create or edit categories so that listings can be better organized.
As a seller, I want to delete my listing so that I can remove it from the marketplace.
As a buyer, I want to interact with an AI chatbot so that I can ask questions like “Do you have a CMPE 202 textbook?” and get relevant listing suggestions without using the search bar.
As a team, we want to decide on the project’s core tech stack so that everyone is aligned on tools, frameworks, and environments before development begins.
As the SCRUM master, I want to set up our Notion dashboard so that we can track sprints, user stories, and progress easily.

ID: US-SETUP-3: Establish GitHub Repository & Branch Workflow
User Story: As a team, we want a shared GitHub repository and clear branching workflow so we can collaborate without merge conflicts.
As a team, we want to define coding and execution standards so that the project remains consistent and maintainable across all contributors.
As a team, we want to research marketplace features and reference apps so that we can design Sprint 2 stories effectively.
As an admin, I want to suspend or delete users who repeatedly violate rules so that the platform remains safe and trustworthy.
As a seller, I want my listing to automatically expire after a set duration so that outdated posts don’t stay visible.
As a student, I want to verify my account using my official campus email ID so that only legitimate users can access the marketplace.
As a developer, I want to create detailed technical and user documentation so that developers and users can understand and contribute to the project easily.
As a user, I want to read FAQs or contact support in case I face issues.
As an admin, I should be able to view all the reports in a separate page/dashboard. Individual report per listing is a plus.
As a buyer, I want to click on a seller’s profile and view all their active listings so that I can explore other items they’re selling.
As a user, I want a landing page for the Campus Marketplace so that I can easily understand the platform’s purpose and navigate to login or signup.
As a user, I want to upload and display my profile picture in the “My Profile” section so that other users can recognize me easily.
As an admin, I want to view analytics showing total transactions and listings so that I can monitor platform activity.
As a developer, I want to design standard email templates for  password reset so that all authentication emails follow a consistent format.
As a user, I should receive the email in a standard template.
UI Fixes like show unread messages, display the listing as a small card when the buyer initiates the conversation too and try to display the unread messages somwhere?
The user should not be able to see his own listing.

In the view listing page, the image should be auto scaled automatically based on the input image given and it should also give an enlarged image view for the user when the user clicks on the image in the view listing page.

ID: US-DEPLOY-1: Deploy Backend API to AWS EC2
User Story: As a developer, I want our backend API deployed on an EC2 instance so that end users can access the marketplace features outside localhost.

ID: US-DEPLOY-2: Configure Load Balancer + Auto Scaling Group
User Story: As a deployment engineer, I want an AWS Application Load Balancer and Auto Scaling Group so that the API can scale automatically and handle real-world load.

ID: US-DEPLOY-4: Point UI to Deployed Endpoints
User Story: As a web developer, I want the frontend calling the deployed API URLs so that demo users interact with the live system instead of local servers.
As a developer, I want to securely manage API keys, DB credentials, and environment variables so deployments are secure and configuration can change across environments.

As a backend engineer, I want consistent API error handling so that all endpoints return predictable, structured JSON errors (validation errors, auth errors, server errors), improving reliability and debugging.
As a user, I want the UI to validate inputs (required fields, formats, min/max lengths, price validation, image requirements) so that incorrect or incomplete data never reaches the backend.

ID: US-FRONTEND-QUALITY-1: Global Error & Success Notification Banners
User Story: As a user, I want friendly and consistent notification banners for success, errors, and warnings so I always know what’s happening during interactions such as posting, editing, chatting, and logging in.
As a developer, I want to sanitize chat messages for unsafe characters, scripts, or malicious payloads so that chat remains secure and cannot be exploited via injection attacks.

ID: US-SEARCH-QUALITY-1: Search Input Sanitization & Query Limits
User Story: As a backend engineer, I want to sanitize and limit search queries so that the search endpoint avoids heavy queries, malicious patterns, or extremely long text that could affect performance.
As a seller, I want the listing form to enforce required fields, minimum lengths, max lengths, and valid price ranges so that listings maintain quality and prevent junk/incomplete posts.

As a team, we need to create the Component Diagram and Deployment Diagram for the Campus Marketplace so our architecture is clearly documented and ready for submission in the README and Demo Day presentation.
As a team member, I need to summarize how our team followed two XP Core Values (Communication, Simplicity, Feedback, Courage, Respect) so we can submit the required write-up in the readme on GitHub.
Create UI Wireframes
